subject: Re: [junit] input cases
msgSnippet: Usually I have several test cases per methods to test various classes of inputs (ie. boundary values, special cases, etc), but if the input data is of the
messageBody:
Usually I have several test cases per methods to test various "classes" of inputs (ie. boundary values, special cases, etc), but if the input data is of the same type and really belongs in the same test case I use arrays and setUp method to cycle through the data.  But please note, I only use this for cases where if one input fails, the entire test case should fail.
 
Here's a quick example that I use for a software testing course I am helping teach.  The simple example is a triangle classifier based on the lengths of its side (ie isosceles, equilateral or scalene),  I believe I have provided all necessary code to compile. 
 
I hope this helps (and in fact this is what you were asking).
 
andrew f

From: kelly, Burrowa

Subject: [junit] input cases

Hi!

For each method in my class there is a testMethod
in the JUnit TestCase class. Can somebody throw light
on how to run the Test for different input cases?

thanks!
kB
